PublicationReferences.Title: Global and regional evaluation of over-land spectral aerosol optical depth retrievals from SeaWiFS

PublicationReferences.Author: Hsu, N. C., Gautam, R., Sayer, A. M., Bettenhausen, C., Li, C., Jeong, M. J., Tsay, S.-C., and Holben, B. N.
PublicationReferences.Title: Global and regional trends of aerosol optical depth over land and ocean using SeaWiFS measurements from 1997 to 2010

Quality:
The monthly product is simply the arithmetic mean of the daily L3 gridded product, with requirement of at least 3 days of data in the month when calculating the mean. 
 
The SeaWiFS Deep Blue aerosol products have been validated by comparison with ground-based instruments from AERONET and MAN. The results are included in the following two papers:  
 
Sayer, et al (2012): Global and regional evaluation of over-land spectral aerosol optical depth retrievals from SeaWiFS, Atmos. Meas. Tech., 5, 1761-1778, doi:10.5194/amt-5-1761-2012 
 
Sayer, et al (2012), SeaWiFS Ocean Aerosol Retrieval (SOAR): Algorithm, validation, and comparison with other data sets, J. Geophys. Res., 117, D03206, doi:10.1029/2011JD016599

Giovanni is a web-based tool that allows users to interactively visualize and analyze data.

Access time aggregated daily SeaWiFS aerosol data through THREDDS service. The THREDDS Data Server (TDS) is a web server that provides metadata and data access for scientific datasets, using a variety of remote data access protocols.

Missing data days in SeaWiFS Deep Blue Aerosol products

Abstract:
This SeaWiFS Deep Blue Level 3 monthly product contains monthly global gridded (1 x 1 deg) data derived from SeaWiFS Deep Blue Level 3 daily gridded data at the same resolution. 

 The primary data parameters are aerosol optical thickness, and Angstrom exponent.

Projects.LongName: Making Earth System Data Records for Use in Research Environments

UseConstraints.Description: The Earth Observing System Data and Information System (EOSDIS) data use policy for NASA data can be accessed at https://earthdata.nasa.gov/earth-observation-data/data-use-policy. For information on how to properly cite and acknowledge data from the NASA GES DISC, refer to https://disc.gsfc.nasa.gov/information/documents?title=data-policy.
